page.title: 05BIOGRAPHY-LUMLEY BENEFACTORS
page.content: {SIR JOHN DUCK,Bart.d.1691}was Lumley's Dick Whittington.Of obscure origins,he trained as a butcher in Durham,married the butcher's daughter, then grew rich from trade in coal and cattle. An old panel depicts Duck standing sadly by a bridge, while a raven drops a silver piece at his feet. It also shows his splendid mansion in Silver St.,Durham, and the alms hospital he endowed for aged poor in Lumley.The hostel bell,in Christchurch, is our oldest artefact. {REV.J.DODD, Ist VICAR OF CHRISTCHURCH, did much for Lumley. He preached daily at Lumley's first National Boys'School and at Duck's Hospital. He organised fund-raising for the new church,for a Girls'school,and later for an Infants' Annexe.He cared for the sick and dying in epidemics. His footnotes to parish registers are fascinating to view -on microfilm in Durham Archives.{M.Smith.
